summary: This is an email exchange between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding access to documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators. The SDNY team prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell seeks to review and scan materials stored in the West Palm Beach office. The SDFL contact confirms the materials are secured and provides an inventory, referencing a prior OPR inquiry and scanning arrangement.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of prosecution by the SDNY team mentioned in the email. The email exchange is about obtaining documents related to the prior investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators for use in her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators. The SDNY team seeks documents from this investigation.

connections.description: The email refers to the prior SDFL investigation into 'Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators,' and the SDNY team prosecuting Maxwell is seeking those documents, implying their alleged connection.

events.title: Email coordination for document access
events.description: Email exchange between SDNY and SDFL offices to arrange a call and access to documents from the prior Epstein investigation stored in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Prior OPR inquiry and document scanning
events.description: Reference to a prior time when the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was at the West Palm Beach office, used a dedicated scanner to send documents directly to DOJ accounts.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell and is seeking documents from the prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

Documents and case files from the prior Epstein investigation are stored in a secure room in the West Palm Beach office, including materials gathered for an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) inquiry.
An inventory of the materials exists, and a prior scanning arrangement for OPR allowed documents to be sent directly to DOJ accounts.
The email exchange is a coordination effort between two U.S. Attorney's Offices regarding evidence sharing for an ongoing prosecution.
